content.description: Start with quick hop to the obvious jug mid wall. Smear feet and throw left to a good horn. Bring your feet up and hit the top.    Alternate start begins on two underclings/sidepulls down and right of the main jug. From the underclings throw to the rail directly above and work left to the main jug(bumps up the grade to ~v1).
content.location: Thin block with graffiti on the east face. Problem is the middlemost line on the boulder. Descend by down climbing the backside.

content.description: Extension of the Hang Glider traverse. Instead of stepping off like Hang Glider traverse, reverse the traverse and get the extra pump and slightly harder moves.
content.location: Same as for Hang Glider Traverse

content.description: Classic tall slab problem. Begin right hand on the arete, stand into the left mono pocket, and begin working up the arete with decent feet. Then move left hand out to a nice left facing flake at which point the feet become very delicate. Find your foot dimples and work up the arete and flake to the top.
content.protection: pads and spotter. Can be top-roped.
content.location: The Big Boulder, the obvious large boulder near the a-frame, a few hundred feet north of the parking area.

content.description: Work across the varnished face on delicate feet and interesting moves. Landing is less than ideal, so hold on.
content.location: One of the northern most boulders. Problem is in a bit of a corridor about 50-75 ft northwest of the A-frame.

content.description: Short one move wonder. Start on the chest level edges, smear feet, and go big! Check your swing and finish in the higher hueco. Possible SDS.
content.location: On the cliff band just to the right of the leaning boulder.

content.description: If only there was more... Start in the chest level undercling, move up to a right hand pinch, then throw for the big ledge, catch the ledge, match and move to the higher hueco to finish.
content.location: On the cliff band 5 feet to the right of Swing Set.

content.description: Sit start compressing the arete, then slap your way up sandy slopers.
content.location: South east arete of boulder south of big boulder(i should probably name these boulders)

content.description: Fun, short, and satisfying! Start matched on the arete under the slight notch. Left foot heel and right foot smear then bump right hand to the notch, cross left up, then throw for the top. Mantle.
content.location: Nestled behind the Big Boulder, the short slightly over hung face with the low hueco. Problem ascends the left arete.

content.description: A fun problem on nice rock. Start in the dihedral and work up the slab using the seam and delicate feet. Pull the mantle to top out.
content.location: The dihedral seam on the southeast corner of the Big Boulder.

content.description: Great movement, nice holds, mostly solid rock. The bottom and top suffer from somewhat sandy, crumbly rock. Start in the low horizontal crack, move intoa pair of nice underclings. set up and finese your way through thin section. Throw up for the lip to exit on slopers.
content.location: Almost directly west of the hang glider boulder. Along the cliff band, 10 feet right of the obvious dihedral.

content.description: Rough low ball fun! Start low on the left side, with left hand in a horizontal seam and right hand in a nice dimple.  Place a left heel hook above your left hand. Pull up and work right via heel hooks and slaps to a nice hueco jug. Match in the hueco and prepare for the burly mantle that awaits.
content.location: boulder with low slung roof directly east of the parking lot, against the cliff band.

content.description: Start on the Right facing holds set your feet and pull up. Stick a left hand mono and then move up onto slopers for the top out.
content.location: On the back side of the Big boulder.

content.description: Start right hand on a decent edge and left up in a good dimple on the lip. Smear your feet and move up the arete, make a tough cross and coast to the top.   Be wary of dabs on the cliff band at your back.
content.location: east of the parking area, the boulder leaning against the cliff band, problem starts at the bottom left of the boulder.

content.description: Slabby and with some high feet. In need of a clean.
content.location: East face of boulder directly south of the A frame and Big Boulder.

content.description: Start left hand in a decent slot and right in a not so decent edge a few feet to the right. Find your feet then your balance and move straight up.
content.location: Problem is located on the Hang Glider Boulder about 5 feet right of the boulder's western edge.

content.description: Sit start with left foot on the rail and bump out to the left crimp. Pull up to the small crimp on the right while looking for a high left foot. Once you find the left foot, throw to the jug with right hand.
content.location: Southwest corner of the warm-up boulder starts in the left facing jugs 3' off the ground.

content.description: Start with hands on the right side of the lower lip, place your left foot throw a right heel and move left to gain the upper lip and the top out.
content.location: On Hawk Boulder, closest boulder, to the parking area.

content.description: Start right hand on the low ledge and left hand a few inches right of the tree on the arete. place feet and move into the deep pocket on the face. Adjust and jump for the lip!
content.location: North face of the boulder sitting south of the Big Boulder and the A-Frame. Start is just to the right of the tree hugging the Northeast arete.

content.description: Start Low on the left side of the boulder. Work your way up and right, toward the crux, with good jugs and feet. Match in a nice jug and enter the crux. Reach out right, searching for a decent dimple sink low bring your left hand over and find your feet. bump your right hand to a jug then work your way to the right until you can step off.
content.location: The first boulder you encounter and the southern-most boulder of the Barn Yard.

content.description: Move your way up the slab using small pockets, slopey crimps and smears.
content.location: the large boulder, with the obvious slab on its northern face, adjacent to the Hang Glider boulder.

content.description: Sit start matched on the small edges of the the slopey bulge mid-face. Smear your feet and make the big move to the lip. Gain the lip and higher jugs for an easy top-out.
content.location: On the middle of the Hawk boulder.

content.description: Start in the obvious dihedral crack. Stem your way up to the top.
content.location: Along the cliff band slightly southwest of the parking area, in a bit of a corridor.

content.description:
Start low on the right side. smear your left foot, throw a heel hook, then fight your way up the arete with slopey and sometimes sandy hands and heels. Gain the jugs, kiss the top, and mantle up.  

  Descend off the slabby west face.
content.location: The obviously "A" shaped boulder, a couple hundred feet north of the parking area.

content.description: Looking for a few hours of just you and the rock? This is the place. The Barn Yard is a small collection of fun, easy access sandstone boulders nestled under the red sandstone spine of the Gallup Hogback. Although the rock can be sandy and crumbly in some places, climbers have been visiting the Barn Yard since the late 90s and the majority of the established problems are very solid. There are mostly easy-moderate problems, with a few projects that could push into the higher grades.
